shortdesc.ph: Stops or resumes publishing the local audio stream.
Stops or resumes publishing the local audio stream.
Stops or resumes publishing the local audio stream.
Stops or resumes publishing the local audio stream.

ul.li: This method does not affect the audio capture state because it does not disable the audio capture device.
This method must be called after joinChannel1 or .
When using spatial audio, if you need to set whether to publish the local audio stream, it is recommended to call this method instead of 's method.
After successfully calling this method, the remote side triggers the and callbacks.
This method does not affect audio capture status, as it does not disable the audio capture device.

When using spatial audio, to configure whether to publish the local audio stream, it is recommended to call this method instead of the method of .
After successfully calling this method, the remote side will trigger the and callbacks.

This method does not affect the audio capturing state, as it does not disable the audio capture device.
You must call this method after or .
When using spatial audio, to control whether to publish the local audio stream, it is recommended to call this method instead of 's method.
After this method is successfully called, the remote user will receive the and callbacks.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: 0: Success.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
0: Success.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when it fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: 0: Success.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and troubleshooting.
